Customer Service Representative Job at Hotel Capitol




        
    

        
        Hotel Capitol is a modern and contemporary hotel that offers not only luxury but comfort at its best. The three-star hotel is strategically located at the heart of Omole Phase 1, making it easily accessible with excellent road networks to other parts of the mainland and the city of Lagos as a whole. The 32-room Hotel offers tastefully furnished deluxe executive and super executive rooms as well as one- and two-bedroom luxury suites.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative
Job Location: Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Customer Service Representative is responsible for attending to customers/guests, handling inquiries, resolving complaints, and ensuring a positive customer experience at all times.
	The role requires excellent communication skills, professionalism, and a customer-focused attitude.


Key Responsibilities


	Welcome customers/guests politely and provide accurate information about services.
	Handle customer inquiries, requests, and complaints professionally and promptly.
	Maintain a positive, helpful, and respectful attitude at all times.
	Ensure customer satisfaction and follow up on unresolved issues.
	Maintain proper records of customer interactions and transactions.
	Work closely with other departments to resolve customer concerns.
	Adhere strictly to company policies, procedures, and service standards.
	Handle telephone calls, messages, and walk-in customers efficiently.
	Maintain a clean and professional front office or service area.


Requirements


	Must possess a minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc in any relevant field.
	Must have 1 – 3 years of experience in customer service (hotel, retail, or service industry preferred).
	Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Must be polite, patient, and customer-oriented.
	Must be able to work under pressure and handle difficult customers calmly.
	Must be well-groomed and professional at all times.
	Must have basic computer skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, email).
	Must be honest, reliable, and punctual.
	Must be willing to work shifts, weekends, and public holidays.


Key Skills & Competencies:


	Strong interpersonal skills
	Problem-solving ability
	Attention to detail
	Teamwork
	Time management.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrteam@hotelcapitol.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Auto-Electrical Technician Job at TruckSoft Logistics




        
    

        
        TruckSoft Logistics is a transport and logistics solutions company committed to providing reliable, safe, and technology -driven haulage services across Nigeria and West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Auto-Electrical Technician

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Auto-Electrical Technician is responsible for supporting the installation, diagnosis, repair, and maintenance of electrical and electronic systems on trucks and fleet vehicles at Trucksoft.
	The role ensures accurate data capture for vehicle tracking, driver behaviour, fuel monitoring, axle load insights, and overall fleet performance at Trucksoft.


Job Description


	Install, maintain, and troubleshoot electrical and electronic systems on trucks and fleet vehicles
	Support the installation and maintenance of GPS tracking devices, sensors, and other telematics equipment
	Diagnose electrical faults using appropriate tools and wiring diagrams
	Ensure proper functioning of vehicle electrical components related to tracking, monitoring, and safety systems
	Carry out routine inspections and preventive maintenance on vehicle electrical systems
	Document installation, maintenance, and repair activities in line with company procedures
	Work closely with operations and fleet teams to improve vehicle performance and data accuracy


Requirements


	Diploma or Bachelor’s degree in Automotive Electrical Technology, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Computer Science / IT, or related field.
	1–3 years of relevant work experience.
	Strong understanding of: GPS/GNSS technology, SIM-based GSM connectivity (2G/3G/4G/5G), IoT sensor systems (fuel sensors, temperature sensors, driver-behaviour monitoring).
	Experience working on commercial vehicles or fleet operations is an advantage
	Familiarity with telematics platforms.

title: Job Openings at APM Terminals
content:
APM Terminals is the global terminal operating arm of the A.P. Moller-Maersk Group. APM Terminals operates a Global Terminal Network of 76 operating port and terminal facilities and 117 Inland Services operations in 59 countries around the globe.

We are currently recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) IT Site Support

Ref: R168804
Job Location: Apapa, Lagos

The Role
     

            
    




	The IT Site Support plays a critical role in ensuring smooth technology operations at APM Terminals Apapa.
	This position is responsible for shaping terminal business demands, aligning requirements, and driving the delivery of IT solutions that enhance operational efficiency.
	Working closely with the Terminal IT Manager and business stakeholders, the IT Site
	Support identifies opportunities for improvement and ensures successful adoption of new IT capabilities.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide frontline IT support for terminal operations, ensuring minimal downtime and quick resolution of issues
	Research and analyze improvement opportunities, prepare recommendations, and implement efficiency solutions
	Develop and maintain documentation for business requirements and process improvements
	Collaborate with service and functional teams to identify and implement technology enhancements
	Support modernization and standardization of terminal technology portfolio in alignment with regional strategies
	Ensure terminal requirements are captured during global and regional technology implementations
	Assist in cost modeling and budgeting for IT projects and terminal tech upgrades
	Manage end-to-end terminal IT demands, including prioritization and escalation
	Drive continuous improvement initiatives across IT processes and systems.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field
	Minimum 3–5 years of experience in IT support or infrastructure management
	Strong understanding of terminal operations and ITIL standards
	Advanced data analysis and problem-solving skills
	Ability to manage multiple demands and deliver under pressure
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
	Experience with IT tools and technologies relevant to terminal operations.


What We’re Looking For:


	Lean-minded: we are looking for someone who brings a strong mindset of continuous improvement – someone who is naturally curious, committed to solving problems at the root, and driven to make things better every day.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Operations Shift Manager

Ref. R168530
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	The Shift Manager is responsible for managing all terminal operations during assigned shifts, ensuring safe, efficient, and cost-effective execution of activities.
	This role is pivotal in delivering operational excellence and outstanding customer service while optimizing resources and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and direct the execution team across vessel, yard, and gate operations to achieve productivity and efficiency targets.
	Monitor and analyze operational performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing solutions.
	Ensure seamless coordination between operations and maintenance to minimize equipment downtime.
	Manage shift costs, including overtime and general expenditures, and contribute to financial reviews.
	Guarantee reliable service to customers by ensuring vessels sail on schedule and operational standards are met.
	Drive compliance with health, safety, and environmental standards, conducting regular safety briefings and investigations.
	Promote consistent application of company policies and fair treatment across the team.
	Provide coaching, feedback, and career development opportunities for team members.
	Embed LEAN principles and TWI (Training Within Industry) in daily operations to enhance efficiency.
	Represent the terminal in meetings with customers, government authorities, and high-level visitors when required.


Requirements


	Preferred Qualifications:
	
		Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, or related field (or equivalent experience).
		Experience in container terminal operations is highly desirable.
		Knowledge of HSSE standards and compliance requirements.
	
	
	What We’re Looking For:
	
		Lean-minded: We are looking for someone who brings a strong mindset of continuous improvement – someone who is naturally curious, committed to solving problems at the root, and driven to make things better every day.
		Proven experience in terminal or logistics operations, preferably in a leadership role.
		Strong people management and communication skills with the ability to lead diverse teams.
		Solid understanding of operational processes and resource optimization.
		Ability to work under pressure, make quick decisions, and maintain focus on safety and service.
		Familiarity with LEAN methodologies and commitment to embedding them in daily operations.
	
	


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Control Room Lead

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers

The Role


	The Control Room Lead plays a pivotal role in coordinating all control room operations during a shift, ensuring safety, productivity, and efficiency standards are met.
	This position requires strong leadership and problem-solving skills to manage real-time operational challenges and maintain seamless flow across quay, yard, and gate activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide operational direction for the Flow Control Room, ensuring adherence to safety and efficiency standards.
	Supervise control room staff in preparing vessel load and work plans, supporting planning managers and coordinators.
	Monitor and coordinate container discharge and load operations for maximum efficiency.
	Ensure smooth communication between control room and execution teams, maintaining strict compliance with communication protocols.
	Anticipate operational stages to prevent flow disruptions and intervene when necessary.
	Lead deviation management, investigations, and intervention activities.
	Promote discipline, fairness, and transparency within the control room team.
	Embed LEAN principles and TWI practices into daily operations, driving continuous improvement.
	Assess skills matrix for control room roles and coordinate training plans.
	Maintain strong relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders, including shipping lines and agents.


What We’re Looking For


	Lean-minded: We are looking for someone who brings a strong mindset of continuous improvement – someone who is naturally curious, committed to solving problems at the root, and driven to make things better every day.
	Proven experience in terminal or logistics operations, with a solid understanding of flow planning and execution.
	Strong leadership and people management skills, with the ability to guide and motivate a team.
	Excellent communication and coordination abilities to manage multiple stakeholders.
	Analytical and problem-solving skills to address operational challenges effectively.
	Familiarity with operational tools, scorecards, and planning systems is an advantage.


Click here to apply online

Note


	Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking.
	Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.
	We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
